dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A Philippine Airlines passenger plane is arriving and tou down.

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANE
dialogues.text: A 13-year old boy starts down the ramp, a suitcase in one hand, an old photo-strip in the other. He studies the str closely as he searches the faces of the people greeting t passengers.

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTO STRIP
dialogues.text: A handsome sailor is necking with his girl in each of the three shots.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOY
dialogues.text: looking around.

dialogues.speaker: HIS EYES FALL ON A SAILOR
dialogues.text: It's the same sailor from the photo strip, only about fif years older. If he was in his early twenties then, now he in his mid-thirties. He's in the uniform of a 1st class P Officer. He searches the faces of the descending passenge very uncertain and uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOY AND THE SAILOR
dialogues.text: come together very, very tentatively. The sailor, BYRON M extends a hand to young ZACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, Zack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Byron. Nice to meet you. (awkwardly) C'mon. Let's go get your luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head off together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Byron and Zack step aboard one of the colorful jeepneys t Manila is famous for. We MOVE WITH the jeepney as it leav the airport and starts down the highway toward Olongapo. The boy is frightened but he's also excited by the strang super-chrome and ornately-decorated vehicle he's riding i They're not alone in the small bus. Ten or more Filipinos ride with them, some in suits and ties, others in the rou attire of farmers. One old woman carries a big cage on he lap with a squawking fluttering chicken in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take that coat off. This is the  Philippines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps Zack out of his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making conversation) How was the flight? They take care  of you okay? Long way from Norfolk,  isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, kid, I was sorry to hear  about your mom. That's pretty rough.  I would've returned your call a lot  sooner but I was out at sea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been calling for four months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's how long I've been out  at sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeepney has only two passengers now, Byron and Zack. roadside sign reads: "U.S. NAVAL FACILITY, SUBIC BAY ... miles."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Known throughout the Seventh Fleet as the armpit of the  Orient, Olongapo is one, long rain-rutted street of gaudy bars and rattan-walled whorehouses. Countless jeepneys careen past with their silly fringe aw and chrome accoutrements, many filled with U.S. sailor bo and officers on liberty. Zack and Byron's jeepney ENTERS SHOT and stops in front o the noisiest and raunchiest bar on the strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. This is where I live.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK AND BYRON
dialogues.text: CAMERA FAVORS the boy as they head for the entrance of th bar, Zack taking in the kinky street activity: "Beenie bo small boned Filipino boys dressed up as exquisite young g hustling tricks on the sidewalk while their sisters loung in the doorway of places like "California Dreamin'" and " Manhattan Club," in nipple-showing tank-tops, licking the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA CONTINUES MOVING with Zack and Byron as they cross through the NOISY bar toward a stairwell at the back. Nav enlisted men are making out openly with bar girls and Zac even sees one little girl stick her hand right down the f 40 of a sailor boy's pants. Byron glances at the boy, a little embarrassed by his dig Zack is staring at every girl he passes, nervous but a li excited by it all, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were in port more, I'd rent a  better place, but this works out  okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in and find two semi-naked prostitutes lying on the bed. Zack's eyes are as big as silver dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you girls were gonna do  some shopping. (gives them money) Tiki, Maria... I want you to meet my  son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls giggle as they hurry into their clothes and lea Byron closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. This is where I live. I  suppose you could bunk over there  and you could go to school at the  base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not finished. I'll only be in  port one week a month and when I'm  here you'd never catch me playing  daddy with you 'cause it's not who I  am. Like I told you on the phone,  you I'd be better off in that state  school back in Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't never going back to that  school, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to kid. Let me spell it out  for you. This is a whorehouse. And I  happen to like my life the way it is  and nobody's gonna make me change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about that. I just ain't  going back. You don't want me? Okay.  I'll find me another place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK DOWN THE STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: Byron appears on the landing above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back here, kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns) What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grudgingly) Okay, okay. You win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightens) Thank you, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop calling me 'sir! I ain't no  officer. My name is Byron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the boy's happy expression we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack sits on the stairs watching a crazy scene taking pla on the long bar. A bunch of jet pilots off one of the car are in town and they're playing a game of "chicken". Each pilot must take a turn being pushed down the bar in a cha on rollers. The winner is the guy who flies the farthest  without bailing out of his chair. The whores are rooting  them on and gambling money is being waved in the air. As  Tiki, one of Byron's girls, climbs the stairs, he catches her hand and gestures questioningly in the direction of t hotshot fliers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot shot jet jockeys. Maybe you grow  up like that, fly mach five, no jive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy laughs. Then Byron comes out of his room, his sea bag over his shoulder. He passes the kids some folding mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, kid. Put this in your shoe in  case you need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack hides the money.

dialogues.speaker: TWO FILIPINO BOYS ABOUT ZACK'S AGE
dialogues.text: They see him hide the money in his shoe.

dialogues.speaker: BYRON AND ZACK
dialogues.text: Byron kisses his two mama-sans goodbye, shakes Zack's han and strides out of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack is walking along the main drag, looking in the curio stores, when the two Filipino boys approach him, smiling  innocently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, palequero. You new in the P.I.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I've been here a couple of  weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna see some nice things, guy? We  could show you around. Nobody knows  this shithole like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two boys laugh and Zack laughs, too, trusting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I guess it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start off together but as they reach a narrow alleyw the two boys shove Zack into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, big spender. Give us some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) Bullshit! Get it out!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first Filipino kicks Zack in the balls.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGHT
dialogues.text: Zack isn't a bad fighter but he's no match for either of Filipinos, especially the leader, who has a way of fighti that is something to watch. He uses his feet. Waving the  other Filipino aside, he destroys the American with spinn roundhouse kicks to his stomach and his face. Zack goes d from a kick to the groin. Another kick to the head and he loses consciousness. His two attackers bend over him to r his pockets. Finding the five dollar bill he's hidden in his shoe, the run off down a dark alley, one of them nearly tripping ov a dead dog.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHTEN ON ZACK
dialogues.text: He stirs. His eyes open. He sits up, wincing from busted  ribs. Reality sits heavy on his youthful features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rough-looking young man rides his Triumph 750 Bonnevill through a Navy honky-tonk area in Seattle, Washington: NO bars, a Seven Seas Locker Club, a credit jeweler, a pawn  shop. The boy who took his licks in the Filipino back alley is a man in his mid-twenties. A long mane of jet-black hair. scuzzy beard. The same cold blue eyes. He wears jeans and big, muddy boots. There's a tattoo of an eagle half-revea under the sleeve of his T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack Mayo drives up and climbs an outside stairway to a s story entrance.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE FLEA-BAG HOTEL
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES WITH Zack down a dark corridor, past a succe of rooms. A door is open, affording him a quick glimpse o woman and child, a sailor's uniform hanging on a chair ne The sailor appears and closes the door in Zack's face. Za consults an old postcard he takes from his pocket and pau in front of a doorway. He knocks authoritatively and shou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shore Patrol! Shore Patrol! Open  up!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later the door opens and Byron stands there, fum to cover his nudity with a little kimono. A naked prostit in her late teens watches from a rumpled bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Byron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, you little shit! You haven't  changed a bit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither have you, pard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come together in a macho embrace like old whoring  buddies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his girl) Hey, honey, look at this! My son!  Isn't he beautiful? (to Zack) You should've called!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were out at sea! Hey, guess what?  I graduated. I got my degree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you quit school. Last I  heard you were on your way to a  construction job or something down  in Brazil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I made some money down there,  then I talked my way into another  college and I did it. I wasn't magna  cum laude but I did okay. You  should've seen me in my cap and gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck didn't you invite me? I  would've come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack's expression sheds some doubt on that subject but By chooses to ignore it. He turns to the prostitute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the phone, honey. Call up  your friend... Gloria... Gloria big  tits. We're gonna celebrate! You  hear that? My son's graduated from  college!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an orgy, all right. Father and son style. Zack and h girl on the left half of the bed, Byron and his girl on t right. Pumping away. Drinking and passing a wine bottle  around. Candles burning in dishes flickering against the seedy wa where the only decorations are monkeywood carvings Byron  brought back from the Philippines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys really father and son?  You're putting us on, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. We're putting you on. What  happened to that joint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it went out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pigeon English) Ay, palequero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ay, palequero. Never hochi in the  P.I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Wha-chu-say, palequero? Short time,  long time, only ten dolla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men laugh and the girls start laughing, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack awakens and finds himself entangled in arms and legs and soiled sheets. He carefully slips free and rises to h feet on unsteady legs, his head pounding, his eyes blood- red. As he's pulling on his shorts, his eyes suddenly take in apartment and the lifestyle it represents: half-smoked jo and cigarettes cascading out of makeshift ashtrays; empty wine bottles; and three naked people, snoring, their bodi draped over one another. A look of profound disgust comes over Zack's face and he  turns away from the scene and heads into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack finds some aspirins and downs them with a glass of w Suddenly, Byron comes in, shoves him out of the way, and  pukes in the toilet. Zack stares at him in an intense way seeing more than the moment, seeing all the other times h played out this scene with this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you looking at? Hand me that  towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack hands him the towel. Byron swigs some mouthwash, the turns to his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that was pretty great wasn't  it? Not as great as that night with  the three stewardesses in Manila...  but pretty fucking nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack says nothing but there's something on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what're you doing in Seattle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready pard. This one's gonna  blow you away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zackie, nothing you do will ever  surprise me, pard, not after some of  the shit you've pulled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I joined the Navy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Byron's face drops and Zack laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... in the Navy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. I'm on my way over to  this officer school in Port Ranier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To fly jets. To be the fastest  motherfucker in the world. You gotta  come and visit me. I'm only a couple  hours away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gave you this idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody. It just came to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Byron starts to laugh and Zack reddens slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this! You... in the  Navy... an officer... that's like me  saying I'm running for fucking  president. Hey, man, look at you!  Hey, officers don't have tattoos!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs until he practically chokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I Ill be seeing you, Pard.  Take care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack leaves the bathroom and starts putting his clothes o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be pissed. I'm on your side,  Pard. I just don't want you to do  something you'll regret. You gotta  give six years to the Navy if you  wanna fly... that's six years with  the most uptight assholes God put on  this earth. Officers aren't like you  and me, man. It's another breed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You afraid you'll have to salute me,  Chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, no! Why would I care about  something as dumb as that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. That's just how it  sounded. Well, I'll see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door and walks out. Byron moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what did you want? A lot of  fatherly bullshit? A big pat on the  back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns, grins) From you, pard? Never. Thanks for  the graduation present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Zackie -- don't go away mad.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Starting CLOSE on Zack's upper arm as he covers his eagle tattoo with a band-aid. WIDEN as he drives through the ga of the sprawling air station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives through the gates and past the guard gate and  disappears into a stand of tall trees. A sign by the road reads: "THROUGH THESE GATES PASS THE F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motors past a line of aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops to let a class of candidates run past in their  fatigues. CAMERA PANS as he crosses the intersection,  revealing a large parade ground where two classes of Avia Officer Candidates are drilling with rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack parks his motorcycle near the F-14 "Tomcat" jet figh plane that sits in front of the Admin. Building like a pi of sculpture, and is directed by a Navy lieutenant to wai with the other civilian types under a tree.

dialogues.speaker: THE ADMIN. BUILDING
dialogues.text: A girl named CASEY SEEGER steps out of a rented car, kiss her parents goodbye and, carrying a small suitcase, appro the same officer. She has the slim, athletic body of a ru and a naturally pretty face without even the slightest hi of makeup, and she finds most of the thirty boys under th tree ogling her as she approaches.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING ZACK
dialogues.text: He flirts with Casey as she joins them under the tree, an she flirts back, taking a place near the five other girls Nearby, two other boys are eyeing Casey. The brain-lookin kid is TOPPER DANIELS. The tall Okie is SID WORLEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would a girl who looks like that  go into the military?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this is the modern Navy.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF SERGEANT EMIL FOLEY, USMC
dialogues.text: strides smartly toward them and comes to a brisk, heel- clapping halt in front of them, a cane tucked under his a like a swagger stick and the traditional "Smokey the Bear hat of the drill instructor on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fall in! Form a line, you slimey  worms! Heels on that chalk line!  Attin-hut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thirty-six civilians shuffle into a single line, ill- concealed looks passing between them as though to say, "G a load of this character."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now when I say "understand" I want  the whole group to say, "Yes, sir!"  Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raggedly) Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe what I'm seeing!  Where've you been all your lives, at  an orgy? Listening to Mick Jagger  and bad mouthing your country, I'll  bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strolls menacingly down the ranks, probing them, plumb them with his squinty little eyes. He pauses in front of  Perryman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop eyeballing me, boy! You are not  worthy enough to look your superiors  in the eye. Use your peripheral  vision! Understand?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice shifts register, becoming almost human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sudden grin) I know why most of you are here.  We're not stupid. But before you get  to sell what we teach you over at  United Airlines, you gotta give the  Navy six years of your life, Sweet  Pea. Lot of things can happen in six  year. Another war could come up in  six years. If you're too peaceful a  person to dump napalm on an enemy  village where there might be women  and children, I'm gonna find that  out. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses in front of Sid, and smiles the friendliest of  smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you doing, Sarge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley's eyes become instantly crazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you call me, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called you Sarge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't call you anything before  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said, 'How're you?' I am not a  'ewe,' boy! A ewe is a female sheep,  boy! Is that what you think I am,  boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauder, Sweet Pea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to fuck me up the ass,  boy? Is that why you called me a  'ewe'? Are you a queer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oklahoma City, Oklahoma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only two things come out of Oklahoma,  steers and queers. Which one are  you, boy? I don't see any horns so  you must be a queer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop whispering, Sweet Pea, you're  giving me a hard on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack starts to chuckle and Foley eyeballs him hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you laughing at me, dick-brain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley pushes his face close to Zack's and tries to stare down. Zack just stares back, totally unintimidated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better stop eyeballing me,  boy, or I'll rip your eyes out and  skull-fuck you to death!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack keeps a straight face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayo, Zack Mayo, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you slip into this program,  Mayo? I didn't know the Navy was so  hard up. (noticing the band- aid) You got an injury there, Mayo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley suddenly tears the Band-Air off his arm, revealing eagle tattoo. Foley leans close to inspect it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get this, Mayo? This is  really wonder work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subic Bay, sir. In the Philippines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I recognized the work. (stares him in the  eye) Be proud of those wings. They're the  only ones you're gonna leave here  with, Mayo-naise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves on to one of the others, short, barrel-shaped DE SERRA. Foley glances at the roster, then at Della-Serra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmmm... Emiliano Santos Della-Serra.  You a college boy, Della-Serra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) Yes, sir! I graduated with honors  from Texas Tech, sir! Math major,  sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't say. See this cane, Della- Serra? See these little notches near  the handle? There's a notch for every  college puke like you, Della-Serra,  who I got to D.O.R. -- drop on request --  from this program. And the first one  I want to carve out of this class is  you, Emiliano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giving him an evil look, Foley turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect to lose half of you before  I'm finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will use every means at my disposal,  fair or unfair, to trip you up, expose  your weaknesses... as a potential  aviator... and as a human being. The  price at the other end is a flight  education worth one million dollars,  but first you have to get past me. (shouts) Lay your suitcases open for  inspection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack and the others open their packs and suitcases on the sidewalk. With his cane, Foley suddenly spears a pair of  lacy underwear in Casey Seeger's suitcase and dangles it  high in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeger, are we going to have to watch  you run around in these for the next  thirteen weeks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for them but he teases her and dangles them o of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some girls will do almost anything  to get laid. Are you one of those  girls, Seeger? Did you put in for  AOCS to get gang-banged, Seeger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey reddens and stares daggers at the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you can yell at me if that's  what you're supposed to do, sir. But  you have no right to insult me, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley pushes his nose right up to hers and screams:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you a beaver sandwich, if  I want to, until the day they  commission you an officer and a  gentleman and I have to call you  'sir'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) My language offend you, Seeger? Well,  maybe the Navy's not for you 'cause  you'll hear far worse out in the  fleet? (in the same breath) You've got five seconds to put your  suitcases in order and prepare to  move out. Time's up. Attin-shut!  Left-humph! Fo-wud-harch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The candidates fall all over themselves trying to follow orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minutes before quitting time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAULA POKRIFKI and LYNETTE POMEROY, two twenty one year o are both looking at their watches as they wait for that m moment. Two older women are assisting them in the job of  stacking and tying brown paper bags, then returning the t stacks to the conveyor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, guys. It's five o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conveyor finally shuts down and the four women join t flow of workers heading for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Paula and Lynette are leaving, Paula calls out to a wo just then getting into a beat-up old Toyota. In her youth easily as pretty as her daughter, ESTER POKRIFKI is now a tired, over-worked woman of 39, looking closer to 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bye, Mom, see you later. (beat) C'mon, Lynette, before she asks when  I'll be home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls hurry toward Lynette's old Falcon, Ester watchi with a mingling of emotions, from nostalgia to concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARTING CLOSE ON shears as they cut a swath through a fo of hair. In a matter of seconds, Della-Serra is converted from a long-haired individualist into a cipher, balder th a baby's butt. He leaves and one of the female candidates sits down in the chair. Whack! Whack! The barber doesn't  shave her but he cuts her long hair very short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley collars Della-Serra and turns to the line of candid waiting to get inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this is my idea of an ass bandit.  Wait 'til some of our local girls  get a look at you, scrotum head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class cracks up laughing, especially big Sid, standin near the end of the line with Zack and Casey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's funny, Worley? Let  me tell you something. Not all the  obstacles that can trip you up are  on this base. (strolling down the  line) As long as there's been Navy base  here there's been what you might as  well call your Puget Sound Debs,  poor girls who come across the sound  on the ferry every weekend for only  one reason, to marry themselves a  Naval aviator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skeptical looks from the candidates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they clear the gates of the National Paper Company Pau reaches into the back seat for her makeup kit, positions on her lap, and adjusts the mirror. Off comes the scarf. Out come the pin curls, one by one and she starts combing out her hair. Their disco dresses, satiny and suggestive  even in their plastic cleaner's bags, are hanging from  separate hooks in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a Puget Deb will tell you, 'Honey,  don't y'all worry 'bout no  contraceptives. I got that all taken  care of.' Well, don't you believe a  word of it, Sweet Pea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula is fleetingly naked as she pulls her emerald green  dress over her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...'cause a Puget Deb will do anything  and say anything to trap you... and  once she has you by the balls, child,  you might just find yourself with a  couple of income tax deductions you  didn't have when you came here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears to be moving, because the scenery is moving by Lynette and Paula have traded places and now Lynette sits the passenger seat, pulling the pin curls out of her hair She finishes and quickly takes off her shirt and bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this all sounds silly to you,  especially in this so-called modern  age...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy in a car traveling alongside the Falcon is getting eyeful. Lynette sees him and gives him a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but you scuzzy college pukes had  better watch out, 'cause they're out  there. And you, Sweet Pea, are the  answer to their dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK to reveal that the two cars are not on the  highway, but aboard an open ferry crossing the Puget Soun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES AHEAD of Zack, Sid and Casey. Navy enlisted behind the counter are handing out "Poopie Suits," "Chrom Domes" and "Boonies" to the candidates as Foley looks on. All the boys are bald. The girls have suffered a military haircut as well, but have been mercifully allowed to keep few inches of coverage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like my Poopie Factory,  Seeger? You enter these doors and  individual with a look that's all  yours, a style, a way about you, a  personality... and you come out a  Poopie! That's sort of like what  happens to food. It goes in looking  all fancy and pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeger grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew those commercials were full  of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA HOLDS on a recruiting poster on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new Poopies come running in, carrying their suitcases and uniform issue, Foley herding them like cattle up the  stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where you live, children!  This is Poopie-ville! Girl Poopies  to the left, boy Poopies to the right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Poopies find their assigned room, the five girls in a wing to the left of the stairwell, the thirty-one boys in the wing to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The names on the door are: "PERRYMAN, MAYO, WORLEY and  DANIELS." Zack is the first one through the door and he g the upper bunk by the window. His roommates come in and s a look as they see what he's done. LOUIS PERRYMAN is a no nonsense black, a few years older than the other, like Za

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you figure that's your bunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it's up to us and I got here  first, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Mayonnaise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fall out on the lawn in five minutes,  in your Poopie suits!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perryman and Topper select lower bunks and start stowing  their gear in their lockers. Sid takes the other top bunk

dialogues.speaker: THE LOCKERS
dialogues.text: Perryman immediately tapes a photo of his family on the d of his locker, wife and two young children, one a baby in diapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a married man, huh, Perryman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perryman touches the photo affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. They're the main reason I'm  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) I still can't believe I did this. A  three-point-eight average from  Amhearst and I signed up for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perryman laughs. Both Zack and Sid are stowing their lock expertly. Zack glances questioningly at the big Okie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in reply to his look) I'm a service brat, pal. Same as  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack takes five new packs of cards from his suitcase and  hides them in his locker under his skivvies. Sid notices do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday you'll have to tell me about  Subic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack says nothing. Both boys start changing into their sl fitting Poopie suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Foley looks like he's been  through a war or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fall out! Fall out!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, Sid and their roommates push out in their Poopie su

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The candidates line up outside, in their Poopie uniforms. Sid lines up between Zack and Casey. For the moment, Fole is nowhere to be seen, but a Navy lieutenant is talking t Navy captain in SHOT b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think there's any truth to what he  was saying about those girls? Is  that still going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it is, Sweet Pea, but he  should've warned you 'scuzzy' female  types about the 'Puget Dudes.' They'll  tell you they're wearing a rubber  but they've bit a little hole in the  end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty funny, Mayo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we'll be roommates, Seeger,  and you'll find out how funny I really  am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley suddenly appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeger, Mayo and Worley -- hit the  deck and give me fifty push-ups. On  the double!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio drops to the ground and starts doing push-ups.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: Lynette's Falcon drives up and the two girls start across the street, carrying boxes of LP's.

dialogues.speaker: ON SID, ZACK AND CASEY
dialogues.text: They're about ten, eleven push-ups along when Casey start to fade. Foley's polished shoes ENTER SHOT and she looks at him sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you need a little work on  your upper body strength, Seeger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads her off to where the other candidates stand at  attention, leaving Zack and Sid alone, doing push-ups. Th eye Lynette and Paula as they walk past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NELLIE RUFFERWALL, 50, the base social director, is chatt with a young Naval officer as the two girls approach in t sexy disco dresses. The officer flirts with both girls as walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula, honey, Lynette... I hope you  didn't call all this way just to  bring me these nice records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing the retreating  officer) No, ma'am. We planned on stopping at  the 'O' Club tonight, one way or the  other.

dialogues.speaker: SID AND ZACK
dialogues.text: About 30 push-ups in. Both are in terrific shape and have problem at all with the push-ups. They watch Paula and Ly talking with the matronly social director across the stre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Look at that hot little blonde!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack is staring at Paula.

dialogues.speaker: PAULA AND LYNETTE
dialogues.text: They leave Nellie with the boxes of records and start dow the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bye girls, and thank you again.  Blue Angels be in next month. You  want me to line you up with one,  just let me know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls start back across the street, in the direction the Officers' Club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far fucking out! I've been wanting  to meet one of the Blue Angels since  I can remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette, watch your mouth! Somebody  might overhear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula, look at the new Poopies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I saw 'em. Poor guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to them) See you in a month when you get  liberty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls) Don't worry. It grows out about an  inch by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughing, they start into the Officers' Club.

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICERS' CLUB ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: A handsome young pilot named DONNY TARLTON, 29, is walkin out just as the girls are entering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flirty) Hi, Donny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, Lynette. Hey, Paula, haven't  seen you for a while. When're we  gonna go out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told you. I don't go out  with guys who've been dating a good  friend. See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-six chrome dome helmets fly into the air and land the lawn and then thirty-six starving Poopies rush into l in front of the mess hall, at close-order attention, nose touching the back of the head of the Poopie ahead of them line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start the count off. When it gets to Perryman he scr up and gives the wrong number. Foley descends on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daydreaming about your wife and kids,  Perryman? You want to join 'em now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count off!! From the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time somebody else fucks up.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The candidates wait in line with their trays held in both hands directly in front of their faces, STOMACHS GROWLING loudly we can hear them. Sid whispers to Zack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) I'm so hungry I could die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go through the food line, staring longingly at the s on a shingle they're being served. Drooling. They stand at attention at their table. Foley putting the through a silly drill of slapping their arms together and sinking, as a unit, slowly into their seats. Each time th fail to do it together, Foley makes them start again. Ste rises up from their trays, teasing them cruelly. Finally, they get it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! You got thirty-five seconds to  get that garbage in your belly, bus  your dishes, and get your asses out  of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go at it like animals, stuffing their faces as fast they can, Zack the fastest eater of all. He finishes in n time at all and busses his tray. He smiles smugly as he p Foley and the D.I. reacts.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CROSS-COUNTRY COURSE
dialogues.text: Foley runs the candidates over the cross-country course w rifles raised overhead. Sunlight filters through the dens trees that overhang the narrow trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jody-calling) Flying low and feeling mean. Spot a  family by a stream. Pickle a pear  and hear'em scream. 'Cause napalm  sticks to kids.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CROSS-COUNTRY COURSE
dialogues.text: Foley runs his Poopies through the surf, past the old  lighthouse, CAMERA MOVING with Sid, Zack and Casey, near end of the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen kids in a free fire zone.  Books under arms, just walking on  home. Last kid walks home alone.  'Cause napalm sticks to kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid glances over his shoulder at Casey, running tiredly b him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Seeger, what're you doing in  this program?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testy) What's the matter, Worley? Am I  threatening you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack runs behind Seeger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, baby, you could get sent to  war, get your ass shot down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lose any sleep over it. I  wouldn't mind being the first woman  to fly a jet fighter in combat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. You can go in my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Casey) Are you really going for jets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. All the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you, Mayo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to tell you guys, but only  two out of every class make it into  jets. Which one of you is going with  me?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CROSS-COUNTRY COURSE
dialogues.text: Foley stands at the entrance to a dark tunnel, watching t candidates run past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's my favorite one now. See if  it ain't your favorite, too. (resuming) Family of gooks sittin' in a ditch,  Baby sucking on her mama's tit. Dow  Chemical don't give a shit, that  napalm sticks to kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS the last of the candidates through the tunnel

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: There's a huge, three-story gun emplacement bunker built 1895, that now serves as a torture chamber for aviation  officer candidates. The other D.I.'s from the program stand at different plac on the time-weathered stairs, waiting to assist Foley, th canes propped behind them, truly cruel expressions on the faces. On cue from Foley, they begin to P.T. Zack's class into t ground, running them up and down the stairs, shouting in  their tender ears until some members of the class actuall start passing out. An ambulance is there with two enlisted attendants to car away the casualties. Zack, Sid, Casey, Perryman and Topper are starting to sho the wear of the arduous "C" course, like the rest of thei class. As they pass the "finish line" where Foley stands, they a fall on their faces, and lie there, gasping for breath. Suddenly, they're distracted by a disquieting sight.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OBSTACLE COURSE
dialogues.text: An advanced class of officer candidates comes running pas the exhausted Poopies in smart-looking blue warm-up suits with an insignia and the name "THRAXTON'S COBRAS" on the  front and nicknames on the back like: "HOOSIER FACE," "TH

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR."
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS them to the obstacle course where Thraxton's  Cobras start eating up the course like child's play.

dialogues.speaker: FOLEY AND HIS CLASS
dialogues.text: Foley sneers down at his exhausted Poopies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's you in thirteen weeks, those  of you who survive. Don't you dare  look at them! You're not worthy enough  to look at them! Della-Serra, I saw  you eyeballing them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack and the others can't take their eyes off the advance class. It's literally impossible to imagine ever being th well-conditioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES AROUND the room, past Perryman's snoring fac past Sid, tossing fitfully, so exhausted he keeps mumblin "Yes, sir," over and over in his sleep... finally HOLDING Zack, sleeping so lightly that the SOUND OF HISSING near hand causes his eyes to open, then harden with disgust at what he's seeing. Topper stands at the sink, pissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck're you doing, Topper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mortified) I'm afraid to go out there, Zack. I  know he'll catch me. He sleeps in  the head, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't sleep in the head, man.  He just says those things. Shit! I  just cleaned that sink this morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack comes out of the head, Candidates Della-Serra and Ma on his heels. Zack wears a white T-shirt and the khaki pa of the uniform they've been issued after "Poopie Week". H shoes are spit-shined to perfection, his belt brassoed to lustrous shine, and his hair is now about an inch long. H pats it back with his hands, primping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another week or two, you'll have  that ducktail back, Mayo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rubs Zack's head and Zack pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I worked on it for thirty  minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack snaps Della-Serra with his towel, spots a couple of  female candidates leaving the woman's head, looks around see if any's watching, and crosses by the stairwell towar Seeger's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack pushes the door open and stands there, grinning, as  Gonzales rushes into her uniform. Seeger just sits there her bunk, in her khaki pants and a bra, spit-shining her  boonies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever heard of knocking, mayo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, did you hear? Sands and  Kantrowitz DORed last night. (His killer grim) Survival of the fittest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole world's a jungle, huh,  Mayo? Dog eat dog down to the last  one, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, Sweet Pea. (eyeing her breasts) Nice boonies, Seeger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey smiles easily and Zack pushes off down the corridor

dialogues.speaker: ZACK WALKS INTO HIS ROOM
dialogues.text: and finds his roommates rushing around in a frenzy, tryin to get squared away. Sid is working like a fool on his bo Perryman is brassoing his belt buckle, and Topper is fold his underwear and T-shirts and then measuring them with a ruler to be certain he has the correct dimensions, before placing them in his locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspection's in five minutes, Mayo!  Give 'em to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Topper gives him a fiver. Totally unrushed, Zack gets up his bunk and starts prying a piece of fiberboard loose fr the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better hope Foley never finds  out about that, Mayo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack pulls the piece of fiberboard free and reaches insid Slaving over his boonies, Sid looks up and sees Zack remo from his stash a perfectly spitshined pair of boonies and hand them down to Topper. Laboring over his belt buckle,  Perryman practically drools as he sees the glistening buc Zack suddenly holds up for him to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two bucks a buckle, Perryman. Look  at that shine! Boonies'll cost you  five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got two bucks? It's costing me  every penny they pay us just to keep  my old Lady and my kids in that motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you got doing all that for you,  man? Some enlisted guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not one to give away his secrets, Zack just smiles, and  replaces the boots and buckle in his stash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, is the piss-ass money you're  making off this worth the risk of  getting us all kicked out of here on  an honor violation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't notice anyone else  complaining.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE OBSTACLE COURSE
dialogues.text: Foley is timing the class over the killer "o" course. Whi most of his classmates are struggling to complete the cou Zack is breezing through it. As he finished, he moves off himself, aloof, confident. Foley watches him closely. He' the only one not rooting for his classmates.

dialogues.speaker: THE TEN-FOOT WALL
dialogues.text: Casey is having a terrible time getting over the wall. Sh doesn't have the upper-body strength for it. Foley saunte up and watches her futile efforts with a cockeyed little  smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you right now you're not  gonna make it, Seeger. First, I can't  graduate you unless you make it over  that wall. You gotta have muscles,  Seeger, if you want to fly my jets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it over the wall, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to be a man, Seeger? Is  that why you're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, if it means getting all the  respect a man gets, then yes! I was  told I could find that in the modern  Navy, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes another run at the wall but fails once more to  scale it. She sinks to the ground and bites her lip to ke from crying. Still, tears well up in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! That's exactly what'll  beat you, Seeger... your mental  attitude as a person of the female  persuasion. Under all your bullshit,  you still think like a second class  citizen, Seeger. You could never  give orders to men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack struggles to comprehend the mumbo-jumbo of higher ph being demonstrated on the blackboard by the instructor, a Navy Lieutenant. All the candidates are using slide rules work out the difficult problems. QUICK CLOSE SHOTS reveal that most of the candidates have pretty fair facility with the slide rule, but Zack looks  like he's never had one in his hand until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARTING CLOSE ON a row of shined boots and a row of shin buckles WE WIDEN to reveal an enlisted sailor and Zack,  scrutinizing the boots and buckles spread out on a Navy i blanket. Zack nods his satisfaction, hands over a wad of  currency, and carefully starts folding the edges of the  blanket around his booty as the sailor disappears into th darkness. Then, as Zack lifts his Santa's sack of goodies over his shoulder, and turns around to go, he stops sudde

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE SID
dialogues.text: He stands there in the darkness, a big grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here Zack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A circle is forming around Zack and Troy. Paula looks  frightened. Lynette looks turned on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come here for a couple of months --  you rich college boys -- struttin'  around in your ice cream suits like  you own the goddamn place -- fucking  our best women... Hey, who do you  think gets left holding the bag after  you're off flying around the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pard, why don't you go back  inside and cool off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away from Troy and pushes out of the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm not finished talking to  you, sailor boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He charges after Zack, and knocks his cap off.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGHT
dialogues.text: If you can call it a fight. Zack turns around and hits Tr in the face with two very fast punches, a left and a righ Before his assailant can recover, Zack delivers a strange roundhouse kind of kick that seems to come out of him in  slow motion, then gathers incredible speed, until it's  slamming with the force of a mule-kick into Troy's face.  Troy goes down gushing blood from flattened nostrils.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: looks around the other locals who clustered earlier aroun their champion, but they're all staring at him, afraid. Taking Paula by the hand, he leads the foursome away.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK, PAULA, LYNETTE AND SID
dialogues.text: Zack stares straight ahead, lost in the world of his  adolescence. Paula just watches him, sensitive to the pla he's in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God! I've never seen anything like  that in my whole life! Did you see  that guy's nose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) Lynette, just keep your mouth shut  until we get to the motel. Will you  do that for me, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, excuse me for livin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid pushes her into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack lies on the bed, aloof, brooding, and doing some ser drinking from a pint bottle of rum. Paula watches from a  chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want a back rub? Might make you feel  better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs onto the bed and tries to position herself to his back, but he pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have done that. I  should've walked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't give you much choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's always a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you learn to fight like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) I don't feel like talking, if you  don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Opening up just a little wouldn't  kill you, ya know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts for the door. Zack barely even looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to fuck you? Is that it?  Okay, come here. Take your clothes  off. Get into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns, angry) Where's that coming from? I wouldn't  fuck now if my life depended on it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. Just get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula starts to leave, then turns back, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explodes) I don't know who you think you're  talking to! I ain't some whore you  brought here! I've been trying to be  your friend and you treat me like  shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a friend. Leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got no manners and you never  tell the truth! You're nothin'  special. And if you ask me, you got  no chance at all of being an officer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack rises from the bed and very slowly approaches her. P almost flinches as he stops a few feet away. Then he lean forward and kisses her as gently as he knows how. Very  tentatively, she responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette leaves her room and knocks on Paula's door. Paula comes out, zipping up her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) A definite improvement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wakes up and slowly focuses on Paula, cooking eggs and bacon in the kitchenette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stayed after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. I've driven a hundred and  twenty miles, told a hundred and  twenty lies, and said a hundred and  twenty Hail Mary's since I saw you.  Hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps out of bed, pulls on some boxer shorts and sits  down at a small rickety table she has beautified with  wildflowers stuffed in a glass. Paula puts his steaming  breakfast before him and stands back to watch him attack He looks up at her and finds her staring at him almost  wistfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula, I never try to fool anybody  about who I am, what I want... so if  even in the back of your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are and what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Paula? What do you  really want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To have a good time with you until  you have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods and turns away, so he can't see her eyes and kno how much she's lying. Zack finishes off his eggs and baco downs his coffee. As she comes over to refill his cup, he unbuttons her blouse and starts playing with her nipples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm. Last night was fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches him with womanly eyes, aware of her own power

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, am I your fantasy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, I dare you not to fall in love  with me. I ain't gonna get serious  with you, no way. But how can you  resist me? I'm like candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're better than candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. It's gonna be hard to  get enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts tickling her and she can't sustain her vamp rol any longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting cocky, aren't you? Huh, you  little Polack? Getting feisty on me,  huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her in his arms and they kiss. The moment turns  suddenly real and Zack finds himself pulling away, afraid the feelings that are churning his guts. Paula studies hi moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, when you're through with a  girl, what do you do? Do you say  something or do you just... disappear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never had a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes stay together for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to thank you for breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time, sailor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our CAMERA is the first to ride the Dilbert Dunker, and w are suddenly shooting at high speed down a steep incline  inside a cage-like contraption, painted red. Wham! We hit water at neck-wrenching speed and go under in a swirl of  bubbles! Wait! What's happening? The goddamn cage is turning  somersaults! Which way is up? Which is way up?? A strange looking alien in a wet suit and mask knifes TOWARD US. Hi hands work to extricate us. We rush toward the promise of light and air at the surface. We can hear our own torture breathing. Will we make it?

dialogues.speaker: CANDIDATE DELLA-SERRA REACHES THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: gasping for air. The DILBERT DUNKER INSTRUCTOR stands off the side, giving him a thumb's down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in line. That was totally unsat,  Della-Serra!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Della-Serra clings to the side of the pool and vomits. He grateful to be alive.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK WATCHES THEM RAISE THE DILBERT DUNKER
dialogues.text: It finally comes to a rest high in the rafters of the  building, where he is to be the next to take the ride. Si and Seeger are right behind him, followed by Topper. He s into the cage and the Instructor makes sure he's buckled  snugly into the harness. Then Zack's eyes fall on:

dialogues.speaker: HIS THUMBS UP
dialogues.text: and the Dunker takes him on its crazy ride, plummeting do the tracks, blasting into the water, somersaulting...

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: waits until the turning has stopped, studies the directio his air bubbles are taking as he unfastens his harness, a pulls himself down and out of the Dunker.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: gets a thumbs up from the Instructor and grins. As he's  climbing out, he watches Sid take the big ride.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: almost loses his composure when the harness at first defi his efforts to get it open. Then, he's free and surface-b

dialogues.speaker: AS ZACK HELPS HIM
dialogues.text: out of the pool, Sid's efforts at a cocky grin fails to h from his friend the fear he felt under there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to watch Casey.

dialogues.speaker: STAY ON CASEY'S EXHILARATED FACE AS SHE PLUNGES
dialogues.text: and watch her extricate herself as easily as Zack.

dialogues.speaker: AS ZACK AND SID HELP HER OUT OF THE WATER
dialogues.text: her eyes are wild with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think they'll let us do that again?  God, that was fun!

dialogues.speaker: TOPPER CLIMBS INTO THE DILBERT DUNKER
dialogues.text: He looks down at the pool far below. His three friends,  standing pool side, give him a thumbs up for encouragemen but Topper is too frightened to acknowledge them. He turn to the Instructor helping to fasten him inside the  contraption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared shitless) Does this thing hit with the same  impact as an actual plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nothing compared to a plane. (beat) Don't forget to watch the bubbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Topper nods and gives a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: IN A PERCH ABOVE THE RAISED DUNKER
dialogues.text: a young seaman apprentice flicks a switch and the Dunker  lurches down the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: TOPPER SUCKS IN HIS BREATH, TERRIFIED
dialogues.text: The impact of hitting the water is so jolting, it knocks wind out in a rush and he goes under already screaming th silent little scream of the mind that drowning people hea Underwater, the Dunker turns him over and over, leaving h upside-down. The silent scream is louder. Panic rides its frequency as Topper tears at the lever that would release him from the harness. He gets it open and pushes out of t opening in the Dunker with all his might. He has forgotte to watch for his air bubbles. Top is bottom and bottom is top. He smashes violently into the tiled floor of the pool, fr out, and swims straight up and into the jaws of the Dunke again.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK, SID, CASEY AND FOLEY
dialogues.text: watch from pool side, concerned, as the diver goes down f Topper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The instant the diver is within grasp of the totally unst boy, Topper grabs him in a dying man's grip that even the brawny frogman is unable to break. The diver hits him once, twice, but Topper clings to him  even tighter and, as they wrestle, the harness further sn them both. The scream now becomes the scream of two drown men.

dialogues.speaker: THE FACES OF THE ONLOOKERS
dialogues.text: Seconds are ticking by, and it reflects on all the faces the huge room.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY FOLEY DIVES, FULLY CLOTHED, INTO THE POOL
dialogues.text: His Smokey the Bear hat and cane stay at the surface as h knifes down through the water toward the churning humanit below.

dialogues.speaker: FOLEY REACHES TOPPER AND THE DIVER
dialogues.text: Both men are so hopelessly entangled in the parachute har and so close to losing consciousness that Foley has to mo very fast. His presence of mind is so total it's frighten With no wasted moves, he frees both men and pulls them to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: The Instructor helps Foley get them laid out by the side the pool and while Foley works mouth-to-mouth on Topper, works on the diver. The diver is easily revived but Toppe required everything Foley has to offer. He might have die in less expert hands but Foley is slowly pulling him thro

dialogues.speaker: ZACK, SID, PERRYMAN, SEEGER AND OTHERS
dialogues.text: watching Foley's efforts to revive their compatriot.

dialogues.speaker: FINALLY, FOLEY STEPS AWAY FROM TOPPER
dialogues.text: and nods to the room of onlookers that he'll be all right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES DOWN the row of lockers. Sid's is a study in neatness, every pair of skivvies folded identically and  measured with a ruler, which is exactly what he's doing a the moment. Perryman's problem is his belt buckle, which is frantically trying to shine before Foley gets there. Z stands casually by his locker, buffing his fingernails, h shoes and buckle shined to perfection, as always. CAMERA HOLDS on the fourth locker, the one that belonged Topper Daniels. The door to the locker is open and it's e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never get it polished in time.  Give me a buckle, Zack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't risk it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd make it. He's just getting to  the girls. Come on, Zack. I gotta  see my family, man. I couldn't take  it if he keeps me here over the  weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, pard. Wouldn't want you to  get an honor violation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid gives him a dirty look but Zack ignores it. The SOUND HARSH FOOTSTEPS approaching and the three candidates snap rigid attention by their lockers. Foley walks in and starts inspecting Perryman. Sweat runs down the black's face in rivers. Foley moves on to Sid, c out his locker, then turns to Zack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In every class there's a guy who  thinks he's smarter than me. In this  class, it's you, isn't it, Mayonnaise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings his cane up suddenly, like a majorette's baton, and with one poke knocks the piece of fiberboard out of i place in the ceiling, allowing two pairs of shined boonie a half-dozen freshly-brassoed belt buckles, and a little  black book recording the monies owed him, to rain down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report to my office in five minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley turns and strides out. Zack meets his roommates' ey for an instant, knowing he's finished. Perryman doesn't l too sad about it. He whispers in Zack's ear as he walks p enroute to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't happen to a nicer guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack stares daggers at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley is doing paperwork at his desk as Zack approaches a knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, Mayo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack enters and stands at attention in front of Foley's d He knows it's all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want your D.O.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. You can kick me out, but  I'm not quitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get into your fatigues, Mayo. Before  the weekend's out, you'll quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack salutes, makes a smart turn, and marches out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley is putting Zack through hell. With his heavy rifle  raised overhead and a full pack on his back, he runs thro the wet sand at the beach, to the cadence of his D.I.'s j call. Foley runs with him a vulture waiting for the  inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jody-calling) Casey Jones was a son of a bitch.  Drove his train in a thirty-foot  ditch. Came on out with his dick in  his hand. Said, 'Listen, ladies, I'm  one helluva man. I went to his room  and lined up a hundred. Swore up and  down he'd (beat) Having fun, Mayonnaise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack is dying under his heavy helmet, but he says nothing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley is running him up and down the weathered old steps, the hot sun beating down on him like a firey fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look over there, Mayo. She stayed to  do that instead of going on liberty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack follows his gaze to the Obstacle Course where Seeger struggling to pull herself over the ten-foot wall, with t same results as last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She may not make it through the  program, but she's got more heart  and more character than you'll ever  have. I've seen your college record.  I've never heard of most of those  schools. Tell me something, Mayo.  Did you buy that degree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir! It was the hardest thing I  ever did, sir! Until this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie, Mayo. You've gone  through a lot worse, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack shoots him a quick look, wondering how much he knows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop eyeballing me, mister! I've  looked through your file and done a  little checking, and I know it all.  I know about your mother. I know  your old man's an alcoholic and a  whore chaser. (beat) Life sure has dealt you some shitty  cards! Hasn't it, Mayo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing okay, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not. You're failing the  big one, baby, and I don't just mean  in here. I mean in life. I've watched  you, Mayo, and you don't mesh. You  grab-ass and joke around but you  don't make friends, not the way the  others do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack says nothing but Foley's getting to him in ways nobo has in years, if ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to know why I'm not an officer,  Mayo? Because I have a servile  mentality from growing up poor...  from always being the kid on the  windy side of the baker's window. That's your problem, Mayo. That's  why you don't mesh. Because deep  down in that bitter little heart of  yours, you know these other boys and  girls are better than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley is putting Mayo through his rifle drills, in the  sweeping light from the old tower. Zack's jaw is set with determination but Foley won't let up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulder arms! Port arms! Parade  rest! (Etc. Etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack lies prone at the top of the bunker, his feet about inches off the ground, Foley standing over him, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what do you say we call off  this little charade of yours over a  couple of beers at Trader Jon's...?  Come on, man. You're about as close  to being officer material as me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, this candidate believes he'll  make a good officer, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, Mayo. You don't give a shit  about anybody but yourself and every  single one of your classmates knows  it. Think they'd trust you behind  the controls of a plane they have to  fly in? Hey, man, I figure you for  the kind of guy who'd zip off one  day in my F-14 and sell it to the  Cubans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, that's not true! I love my  country!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Sell it to the Air Force, Mayo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley puts his lips close to Zack's ear and whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get down to it. Why would a  slick little hustler like you sign  up for this kind of abuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack's legs are shaking wildly with the effort to keep th aloft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to fly, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no reason. Everybody wants to  fly. My grandmother wants to fly.  You going after a job with one of  the airlines?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to fly jets, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Because you can do it alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, the kicks? Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to do something anybody  can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity you don't have the character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true, sir! I've changed a  lot since I've been here! And I'm  gonna make it, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a fucking chance, asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack bolts up suddenly, meeting his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defiantly) I got nothing else to fall back on.  Sir! This is it for me... and I'm  gonna do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley studies him with squinty eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Mayo. Get on your feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men get up and start walking back toward the base.

dialogues.speaker: THEM
dialogues.text: Suddenly they both see a sailboat tacking past, no more t fifty yards off shore.

dialogues.speaker: THE SAILBOAT
dialogues.text: There are three people in the boat, two girls and a boy  wearing a sack over his head. All three wave in their  direction. On cue, they turn around, drop their drawers, give a three-way B.A. They pull their pants back up and t around to yell at Zack. The girls are obviously Paula and Lynette. The boy with the sack over his head just has to Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disguising his voice) Don't give up the ship, Mayo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang in there, Zack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn the torpedoes and remember the  Tides Inn Motel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all three laughing so hard they nearly capsize.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK AND FOLEY
dialogues.text: The drill instructor is amused but trying not to show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayo, are those your friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there's hope for you yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack is on his hands and knees, scrubbing the floor, when Sid, Perryman and some of the others return from liberty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still angry) I see you didn't DOR, Mayo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sid, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: PERRYMAN WALKS INTO THEIR ROOM
dialogues.text: and stops as he sees the peace offering on his bed: his b shined to perfection, and two gleaming belt buckles. Sid  comes in a second later and they share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three candidates lie awake in their bunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys still awake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grunt from Perryman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, do you guys ever... feel like  you don't belong here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. All week long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Sweet Pea. Foley  finally starting to get to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what he was running on me  all last week? He told me I wasn't  officer material because I think  black and I'd never get comfortable  giving orders to whites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? He's been telling me I'm not  officer material because I'm not  inner-directed. He thinks I'm here  for my folks... and for my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That isn't true, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack shakes his head, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about that prick! He told me he  wasn't officer material because he  grew up poor like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he grew up poor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid on the windy side of the  baker's window. That's how he put  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley's not poor. Buddy of mine in  oh-four told me he's the son of a  rich doctor down in Louisiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Friend of mine in oh-two  told me he comes from a long line of  Baptist ministers from Georgia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three candidates crack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about that prick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are making love. When it's over, they lie there for long time in one another's arms, flagrantly satisfied, an still joined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was great.
