dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a little smile of satisfaction. They chuckle. longer they stay together, like that, the more painfully  intimate the moment becomes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to get a towel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to move. But somebody  has to move sometime. Eventually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found them like that, shriveled  up from weeks without food or water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack laughs and the connection is nearly broken. Suddenly Zack just takes her face in his hands and kisses her in a most loving way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All week I kept thinking about you  guys in that sailboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were pretty drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula takes his officer-style cap and puts it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, sometimes I wish I was one  of those girls they're letting in  the flight program these days. God,  I'd love to fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's stopping you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula seems to consider it for a moment, then she shakes head. It's a fantasy, that's all, far removed from the  realities of her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what the magazines say...  it's just not as easy being a girl,  especially from a Catholic family.  You don't know the junk I grew up  listening to, 'bout the way women  are supposed to think and act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no excuse for not going after  what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says I'm not going after what I  want? My mother's thirty-nine years  old and she still works in that  factory. Every time I see her, I  know exactly what I don't want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a stretch of silence, Zack retreating into him his eyes somehow far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a silence) My old lady swallowed a bottle of  pills one day while I was at school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing that really got to me...  she didn't leave a note. Nothing.  I've always hated her for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it still hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. You're alone in this world no  matter what kinda folks or background  you had. Nothing hurts, pard, once  you got that one down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula studies him a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet most people believe you when  you feed 'em that line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her and smiles, then she kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six jets fly DIRECTLY AT US, jolting our senses.

dialogues.speaker: ON INTERCOM
dialogues.text: The program consists of six aircraft performing a sequenc of maneuvers in one of three different components: a diam of four aircraft, two solo aircraft that oppose each othe along the line of flight, and all six aircraft in a delta formation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they enter and move toward the bleachers where Sid and Lynette are already seated. Zack suddenly stops and scans the bleachers, looking for somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I can't sit with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. Maybe we'll see each  other after the show...

dialogues.speaker: BYRON MAYO
dialogues.text: He sits in the bleachers about ten rows higher than Lynet Sid and Paula. Zack slides into the seat beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you doing, pard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Byron's eyes are on Paula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody. Just a girl I've been making  it with the last couple of weekends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I sort of thought so myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better watch out for that kind,  Zackie. You know what they call 'em,  don't ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back east in Newport, Rhode Island,  they call 'em the Fall River Debs.  In Pensacola, the Mobile Debs. In  Norfolk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That what she was... a Norfolk Deb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? (realizing) Aw shit, Zackie, let's not get off  on your mother again, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testy) What if I want to talk about her,  pard? What then? You know, that's  all I've ever heard from you, since  I was a kid... you never want to  talk about that, man, and it's  important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to talk about. Two  goddamn times I made it with your  old lady. We barely even talked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JETS ROAR close overhead and Zack has to raise his vo to be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how she told it. She said  you wrote her every week you were  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wrote. Not every week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said you told her in every letter  how much you loved her, how you wanted  to marry her, have children with  her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said any of that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found them, pard, and read them  myself, right after she did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Okay, I wrote those things... and  yeah, I had big thoughts of getting  together with your mom... but when  she hit me with being pregnant, I  saw who she was. I'd had quiff lay  that shit on me before!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly livid) What did you call her? What did I  hear you call her, you son of a bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men rise angrily to their feet, but a split second l the Angels are making another pass over the stands and  everyone is standing and applauding, making their argumen less public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming above the  noise) She loved you, you bastard! And she  believed you when you said you loved  her! She never gave up thinking you'd  come back (beat) Don't you ever talk about her like  that again or I'll kill you, Byron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack pushes toward the exit, shaking with anger.

dialogues.speaker: PAULA
dialogues.text: watching him and suddenly rising to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack is halfway to his parked motorcycle when Paula sudde appears, running after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps walking but she overtakes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Go back to the show, Paula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen all that a hundred times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) Hey, will you just leave me alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula stops, hurt. Zack keeps on walking toward his bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) Yeah, I'll leave you alone! How about  forever? That long enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stomps off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: PAULA
dialogues.text: She fights her tears but they well up in her eyes anyway. The SOUND of Zack STARTING HIS MOTORCYCLE, then he comes  rumbling up beside her, smiling apologetically. Paula won even look at him. She just keeps walking. So he motors ar in front of her again, blocking her path. She tries to go around him but again he cuts her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Hey, isn't it about time you had me  over for Sunday dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula looks at him like he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Invite me. All day the idea  of a family Sunday dinner's been  coming into my head. Since you're  the only one I know around here with  family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, I don't know if I want to do  that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, Sid and Lynette come walking up from the  show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Paula. We'd better get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula starts off with her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what about Sunday dinner? When're  you gonna let me know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to him) When I'm good and ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets into the Falcon with Lynette and they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: SID AND ZACK
dialogues.text: Zack revs his motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a matter, Sweet Pea? We'll  have a little fuss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid gets on behind him and they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula and Lynette leave the wheelhouse, carrying cups of  coffee, and we TRACK with them to the back of the ferry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You serious about having him over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't made up my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA HOLDS as they reach the fantail and look back at t lights of Port Ranier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula, how far would you go to catch  Zack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. Would you...  let yourself get pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way... Would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never used to think I'd do something  like that, but now I'm not so sure.  You ask me, nine weeks just ain't  long enough to get a guy to fall in  love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That don't justify trying to trap a  boy by getting pregnant, Lynette!  Nothing justifies that. I can't  believe you're even thinking like  that. I mean, that's really backward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more backward, if you ask me,  than the way these hotshot assholes  fuck us, then ditch us. (beat) Don't you ever feel used, Paula?  Don't you ever feel like if this is  all you get for your trouble then  the sonofabitch ought to be paying  for it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I never feel like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As mother and daughter prepare the Sunday meal, Ester fin herself studying her daughter almost as if she were seein herself as a girl, in Paula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look real pretty, darling. I'm  sure everything'll go just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I don't want to be a fool. I  like him a whole lot but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you can only be yourself. If  that isn't enough for Zack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both women move to the window as they hear his MOTORCYCLE APPROACH. Zack motors up, and starts for the door, a bouq of flowers in his hand, his white liberty uniform almost  sparkling in the bright sunshine. Esther's eyes become so almost limpid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a young girl again) He's very handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula looks at her for a moment, then leaves the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Pokrifki is watching Zack from the living room window threatened to his core. The DOORBELL RINGS and Paula move past him to answer it. Seeing the expression on her fathe face, she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, please be nice to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe just stares at her. The DOORBELL RINGS AGAIN and she  opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack stands there with the flowers in his hand, smiling  eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are those for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're for your mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flowers he brought are in a vase on the table. Esther serving out helpings of stew. As she serves Zack, she mee his eyes and smiles an almost flirtatious smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again for the flowers, Zack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure, Mrs. Pokrifki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the table from Zack, Joe is staring their way in a most hostile manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many more weeks before you  graduate, Zack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just three, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, a flirtatious look. Joe sees it. And so does Paula To compound matters, Paula's little sisters are also flir with Zack, and Joe Pokrifki is taking it all as a threat his castle, an outright attack on his manhood. Finally, Zack can handle his stares no longer. He smiles most disarming smile and meets the man's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, excuse me, but why're you looking  at me like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't mean anything by it, Zack.  Do you, Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean anything by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great dinner! Mrs. Pokrifki.  Absolutely the best meal I've had in  a long, long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esther is staring at him with faraway eyes, and her answe comes as though on a time-delay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Oh... yes... thank you, Zack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embarrassed to the point of tears, Paula rises to her fee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Zack. Let's go for a walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack rises and follows her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they leave the house and start down the street, Paula  starts to cry and Zack puts his arm around her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so embarrassed. I knew I shouldn't  have brought you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. It was a great free  meal. Everybody was so uptight I  felt sorry for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. I'm used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in silence for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, after you graduate you go on to  basic flight, right? Is that in  Pensacola?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, then if I get jets, it's on to  Beeville, Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More silence. Paula words her next question very carefull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, do you ever think about what  it'd be like to have kids... a family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying) No. Is that what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some day. When I'm sure I can do a  better job of it than my folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do differently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a start, I wouldn't marry a man  I wasn't in love with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd your mom marry that guy if she  didn't love him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because my real father wouldn't marry  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your real father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula takes her wallet out of the hip pocket of her jeans and hands him a weathered old photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... him.

dialogues.speaker: THE OLD PHOTO
dialogues.text: is of a handsome young flight candidate in uniform, with stylish little moustache and dark bedroom eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Zack looks up from the photo, shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your real father was an Officer  candidate like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-two years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder he was looking at me like  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula watches him closely. Zack checks his wristwatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Time to get back to the wars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her perhaps a little too quickly and starts tow his parked motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me during the week if you get  the chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try, but this week we go into  survival training, so I can't make  any promises. (lamely) Well, thanks again for dinner. Thank  your mom again for me, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. (beat) Zack, I hope you know I didn't have  to show you that picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a smile that almost quells her concern, he drives of Paula watches him until he disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING THROUGH the passenger window, PAST Sid and Lynet making out hot and heavy, TO Zack as he drives up on his  motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out and get on behind Zack.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA MOVES WITH SID AND ZACK
dialogues.text: as they drive to the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kid you not, Mayo, I am in love.  We must've set a new indoor record  today. You want to know how many  times we did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) You'd better get smart, man. It's  time to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You've gotta be kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what Foley said? His little  warning? Those are the girls he was  talking about. They're out to marry  us any way they can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe that. They're just  having a good time, same as us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they want you to think,  but I saw where she lived, what is  she's trying to get away from. (urgently) Just take my word for it, pard. Break  it off now. Do it this week.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE SURVIVAL COURSE
dialogues.text: Zack, Sid, Casey, Perryman and Della-Serra are struggling erect a shelter in the driving downpour, using a parachut and logs they've cut. It's a hokey little tepee at best b they crowd inside it as THUNDER and lightning herald a bl of monsoon-like rainfall. The shelter collapses on top of them.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TENT
dialogues.text: The five candidates are sitting around inside the tent,  listening to the rain, Zack slightly aloof and pensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about you guys but I'm  starving.

dialogues.speaker: ELGIN AIR FORCE BASE
dialogues.text: In the hinterlands beyond the Navy base is an Air Force b with vast acreage of swamplands and tundra. A big truck c bouncing along a windy little road into the undergrowth. truck stops and the candidates from Zack's class file out the back of it while Foley comes around from the passenge seat to address them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, worms. This is it. Can you  pussies live through three days  without food or water in the  wilderness? This is where we thin  our ranks the "natural" way, children.  Incidentally, those little twigs you  see floating in those mud puddles  aren't twigs. They're water moccasins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reveal that he's right. Lethal-looking snakes slither and glide over the surface of the swamp waters.

dialogues.speaker: THE FACES OF THE CANDIDATES
dialogues.text: reflect what you'd expect. Fear. Even Zack looks wary of ordeal ahead.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS
dialogues.text: captures the humor of the next three days of survival  training. The candidates are a sorry spectacle the first and a half, trying to catch snakes with forked sticks, tr to rub wood together to start a fire, throwing up from ea the wrong berries, but generally clowning around, not tak it too seriously. Then, as hunger sets in, a change comes over them. They set up a big tent for shelter, get a nice fire going, and prepare a serviceable meal from carefully selected roots, berries and tree bark, and strips of frie water moccasins. On the third day they plot a path throug the wilderness and finally emerge onto a highway where Fo waits with the truck. The candidates send up a weary chee and embrace each other as if they'd just pulled off an es from a POW camp.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE SCOTT PAPER COMPANY
dialogues.text: Paula is on the line, sorting colors, while Lynette talks a payphone on the other side of the cavernous room. The n of the processors and conveyors is terrible, but her cowo Bunny, 38, a faded, jaded deb if there ever was one, call to her above the din:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Lynette still seeing those  flight candidates over to Pensacola?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What makes you think we wouldn't  be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Friday... three forty  in the afternoon and not a word out  of you about where you're going,  what you're doing over the weekend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula says nothing. She glances over at Lynette again,  hopefully. Bunny takes it all in, the consummate deb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comes a time right after they get  through survival training when they  start to think they can make it  without you. Suddenly they stop  calling. Suddenly they own the goddamn  world. (beat) He hasn't called you by now, Paula,  he ain't gonna call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just keep your mouth shut, Bunny.  You don't know so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May they all crash and burn.

dialogues.speaker: LYNETTE AND SID
dialogues.text: He's at the barracks pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid Worley, I think you're ashamed  of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashamed? No -- I love you, Lynette.  I mean that. After I leave them,  I'll meet you at the motel, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you won't take me to dinner with  your parents, I won't meet you at  the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette, I told you already, it won't  work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, I'll see you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: THE FACES OF WOMEN WHO WORK AT THE OTHER CONVEYORS
dialogues.text: turn to watch Lynette as she returns to her place on the  tissue line. There's a saying that Mobile Debs never die, they just go on working for Scott. The way some of the women watch her and shake their heads little, suggests that it might have some basis in truth.

dialogues.speaker: LYNETTE RESUMES HER PLACE ON THE LINE
dialogues.text: and struggles to come up with a perky grin, but then it s on her face like it belongs to someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, so much for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette, did he say anything about  Zack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette shakes her head, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover for me while I make a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves off suddenly, toward the phone.

dialogues.speaker: AT THAT MOMENT, ZACK AND SID ARE LEAVING THE BARRACKS
dialogues.text: The Officer of the Deck comes out of the building a few  seconds later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mayo. There's someone named  Paula on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Tell her I already split.

dialogues.speaker: PAULA PUTS DOWN THE PHONE
dialogues.text: and returns to the line. All the old debs watch her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARTING ON Zack, eating at Mach Five. THEN INCLUDE Sid a his parents, TOM and BETTY WORLEY, two of the world's  straightest human beings, stiffly WASPish in spite of the down-home Oklahoma drawls, people with so much moral fibe it shines humorless through everything they say or do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack's only a tenth of a second off  the all-time obstacle course record.  He's bound to break it soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wonderful, Zack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son is the one reason I'm still  in the program, Mrs. Worley. He's  pulled me through every exam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are lucky you didn't go  through the program when I did. They  used to start that Dilbert Dunker  twice as high as they do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full of food) That's really interesting, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you couldn't just quit like you  can now. When I went through it...  and when my oldest boy went through  it... if you bilged out you were  sent into the fleet as a swabby. (suddenly) Sid, how come you haven't written  Susan in over three weeks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid looks stricken. He glances at Zack, sees his quizzica expression, and looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't had time to write anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, is my son involved with a local  girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ma'am. All he ever talks about  is, us, Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES with Sid and Zack as they make their way tow the LOUD ROCK MUSIC coming out of the legendary "TRADER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for covering for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, but who's Susan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My girl back home. We're supposed to  get married after I get my wings.  She was Tommy's girl. They were  engaged to be married before he died. (beat) I should've told you about her. I  don't know why I didn't, except I  didn't want you to think I was a  shit for making it with Lynette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not your folks, man. You love  this... Susan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the sweetest person I've ever  known. Loves kids. Works with  handicapped kids every afternoon at  the church. Everybody loves her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask you all that, Sweet  Pea. I asked if you loved her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted) Listen, I'm not going to go to that  little reunion party. I'm meeting  Lynette at the motel. (a sheepish grin) Best head in fifty-two states. After  three days of survival training, how  could I resist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack rubs his buddy's bristle-brush of hair, affectionate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've done what I did. A  clean break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette told me it really tore her  up when you didn't call this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For an instant, Zack's mind seems to be on Paula, but he  pushes her out fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's women for you, pard. They  tell you they're in it for the laughs,  but it's always a fucking lie. (a loud whoop) Look out, Trader Jon's, I'm in the  mood for some fun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He mock salutes Sid and disappears into T.J.'s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARTING ON THE PHOTOS of The Blue Angels that crowd the  walls... a lithe, young stripper DANCES INTO FRAME. Hangi from a net overhead are countless model airplanes. Seeger, Della-Serra, Perryman and Zack are at the bar, dr raised in toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys -- we did it. We survived!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clink glasses. As the others sip their beers, Zack d a double shot of tequila and pushes his glass toward the  grizzly-looking bartender, old TRADER JON himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me another double Tequila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His shipmates share a look. Seeger's attention then shift to the dancer. What a body she has. Perfect little coffee cup breasts. A bottom that tightens and relaxes like a fi as she dances to the loud, rock music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching the dancer) Not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So women turn you on, huh, Seeger? I  always thought you were a dyke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool it, Emiliano. I don't find it  funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES with the dancer, away from the group and we:

dialogues.speaker: SHORT TIME LATER
dialogues.text: Zack is hoisting a chair with shells onto the bar top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smashed) Lemme show you little game called  "Crash and Burn".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs up on the bar and sits down in the chair. The  Olongapo Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up, dick-brains! This is how  we separate the jet jockeys from the  helo-boys. Guy who flies the farthest  without crashing and burning... he's  hot shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeger, Perryman and Della-Serra glance nervously around place. Nobody thinks it's that funny, especially Trader J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mayo! You're gonna get our  asses in trouble, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down from there, before they  call the shore patrol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Give me a push! Never hochi  in the P.I. you see jet-jockey so  hot like me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy, cool it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeger approaches Zack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, we've got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trying to have fun. That fucking  prison is really starting to get to  me. C'mon, Seeger. Gimme a push. (beat) Fuck you guys! I'll do it myself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes off with his feet and the chair glides down the bar, knocking over glasses and beer bottles. The chair an its rider topple over the bar and Zack goes sprawling ont table, laughing like a looney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeger quickly turns to her cohorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys take care of Trader Jon  while I get him out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perryman and Della-Serra nod and head off to deal with th man while she goes to Zack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Zack. We've got to get out of  here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He allows her to lead him toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey pushes him into the backseat of a taxi, but Zack gr her by the hand and tries to pull her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Seeger. Let's go to the Tides  Inn Motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her close and kisses her on the lips, but she ge pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're cute, Mayo, but you don't  want me. And to tell you the truth,  I don't want you. (a quick kiss) See you back at the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives the driver a fiver and the taxi drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid lies in bed, staring up at the ceiling. WIDEN to incl Lynette, just starting to get dressed beside the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, shouldn't you have had a  period by now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little late, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What difference does it make? If  anything was to happen, which I'm  sure it isn't, it would be my  responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly how late are you, Lynette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing him) What do you care? Suppose I was  pregnant. Just suppose it. You don't  think I'd try to make you do anything  you don't want to, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But that's not the only issue  here, sweetheart. There's a lot more  to it than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's like an expert fisherman, working her catch, easing in so deftly it never feels the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What other issue is there, Sid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My responsibility as its father, for  one. I mean, if I've made you  pregnant, I'd want to... do the right  thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette waits hopefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'd want to pay for the abortion...  I'd want to be with you through the  whole thing... by your side. (beat) So how late are you, Lynette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) Let's just wait and see what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finishes dressing and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack sits in the shower, the water blasting down on his h Sid bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack? God, I'm glad I found you. I  need to talk to you, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack is a zombie. He groans and gestures Sid off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me in the morning. I feel  like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it can't wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses close to the shower, so preoccupied he doesn't even notice the water spattering his uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess fucking what! Lynette's missed  her period. What am I gonna do, Zack?  What can I tell my folks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What on God's green earth do I say to Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Sweet Pea. She seen a  doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but she's gotta be at least a  month late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't mean shit. Get her to a  doctor. You can't do anything until  you hear what he says. Make the  appointment yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class is taking a critical multiple choice exam. Zack struggles against his basic instinct to cheat off of Case paper. He's still slower than most of the others but he's doing okay. It's Sid who's slipping under. His mind is so far away he hasn't even bothered to write his name at the top of the exam paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class, down to a scrappy 23 survivors, comes running after the exam, Foley right on their heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fall out on the lawn in five minutes!  This is your last shot at the 101  Course... Mayo... Seeger... Della- Serra...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the rest of the class goes bounding up the stairwell. rushes up to the O.O.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, request permission to make an  emergency phone call, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The O.O.D. nods and Sid starts feeding quarter into the  payphone on the wall. Zack hangs back, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it, Mayo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack glares at Foley and runs up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE OBSTACLE COURSE
dialogues.text: STARTING TIGHT on Seeger's face as Foley starts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts several of the others AD LIB. Then it's Zack's  turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack takes off across the course with a gleam in his eye. wants that record. Zack dances through the innertubes, ha over hands the parallel bars, and churns his way through stretch of knee-deep sand, his classmates cheering him on wanting the record, too, wanting to leave their mark. They all wear warmups similar to the ones worn by the cra squad they saw in the early days of training, except that their shirts are gold and their pants are blue. On the front of their shirts is an insignia and the words "FOLEY'S FIRE EATERS." Their nicknames have been printed  boldly on the back: "MAYONNAISE," "B. SANDWICH," "THE MAR

dialogues.speaker: MAN," "THE WILD WOP,", (DELLA-SERRA)
dialogues.text: WORRY?," ETC. Across the back of Foley's all red warmup s are these words: "YOU'RE PISSING ME OFF, BOY!" As Zack passes his slower classmates, they add their shou of encouragement to the cheering from the sidelines. "Do Mayo!" "Put our name up there, Mayonnaise!" "You can do i Zack shimmies up a rope, yanks his body over the low hurd crawls on his back under the low horizontal bars, scamper up the angled beam, leaps the moat... and is approaching wall full tilt when he sees Seeger up ahead, struggling a usual to get over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Come on, Seeger! Let's go over it  together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes it in one leap but she falls back to the ground, beaten. Zack pauses at the top of the wall and looks down her. Foley watches from the distance. Zack drops back down beside Seeger. She has tears of  frustration in her eyes. She's not going to make it and the realization that she's come this far only to fail is crushing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, Zack! Go for the record!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the record. Now you listen to  me and do exactly what I tell you. (he draws a line with  his foot) Start back ten yards and take off  from here. Not here... or there...  but right here! (the total officer) No excuses, Seeger! You are going to  plant those legs here and then you're  going to yank yourself over that  wall because you have to! You want  jets? Then do it, goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeger nods, almost mesmerized by his decisive tone of vo his sudden emergence as a leader. She starts running, tak off exactly on the mark, and struggles to the top of the  wall. She drops down on the other side and Zack joins her, smil

dialogues.speaker: FOLEY STOPS HIS WATCH
dialogues.text: and shakes his head. He can live without that record.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK AND CASEY
dialogues.text: As they finish the course, they stop and hug each other.  Then something catches Zack's eye that chases the good  feelings away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Sid is trudging slowly toward the 101 Course in his  warmup, his nickname: "LOVERBOY" somehow ironic, especial in this moment. Sid sees Zack looking his way and signals the news to him by putting his arms into a baby-cradling  position and rocking the imaginary off-spring from side t side.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE MESS HALL
dialogues.text: Zack and Sid are in line, getting their food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a big religious thing with her  and she won't even discuss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she expects you to marry her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said it was up to me. If I don't,  she'll go off and have the baby on  her own somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the mention of the word "baby" nearby classmates perk  their ears up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the problem? Girls do that  all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let her go off and have the  kid by herself and not do anything.  If it's my kid, too, then I've got a  responsibility, don't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if she won't even talk about an  abortion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it would still be my kid. That's  the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know that for sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave the food line and start toward the tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but what if it's like Foley  said and she got knocked up, to trap  you -- is it still your  responsibility?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter how it happened, if she  goes ahead and has it" Zack, there'll  be a child in the world that's mine -- and I couldn't go through life knowing  that and not knowing its name or  where it lived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Sid! Is everything  your responsibility?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid and Zack sit down with their classmates and start eat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother getting killed instead  of you... Isn't that why you promised  to marry this Susan? Isn't that why  you do everything, man? Out of some  bullshit code of ethics you inherited  from your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley can be seen at the Instructors' table, IN SHOT BACKGROUND, watching them, but Sid and Zack are oblivious their audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) Maybe it's all bullshit to you, but  that's now how I was raised. I believe  we have a responsibility to the people  in our lives -- that that's the only  thing that separates us from the  goddamn animals! (beat) I'm not like you, Mayo. I can't just  shit on people and then sleep like a  baby all night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words sting and Zack flares back at his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a responsibility to you first,  pard -- and if you can't handle that,  you've got bigger problems than  getting a girl pregnant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other a long time, but no more words c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing full oxygen masks, Zack and Sid are part of a gro of six candidates playing pat-a-cake at simulated altitud inside the claustrophobic-small decompression chamber. An INSTRUCTOR is explaining the test over an intercom, from  outside the windowed chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now everybody take off your masks  but continue the same exercise. The  purpose is to show you the effects  of altitude on the motor skills when  you've been cut off from your oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly their reactions begin to deteriorate. At first Sid seems amused by his and Zack's fumbling to slap hands. Th as a SHINING SOUND mounts into a crazy place, he begins t panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly, calling) Stop this thing! I said stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at him strangely. Sid lurches like a drunk his feet and tries to move toward the door. He trips over himself and falls, then stays there with his hands on his ears and his body curled into a fetal position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want out! Let me out! Please! Let  me out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack extricates himself from his harness like a man with  eight thumbs condemned on top of it to move in slow motio He weaves, drops to his knees by Sid, and awkwardly tries enclose him in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid, it's okay. Don't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHINING STOPS as they start to back off on the pressu inside the chamber, but they can't do it too fast. Slowly Sid comes to his senses, and his eyes focus on Zack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I felt like... like  I was suffocating... Christ, Zack...  I was so scared... so godddamn  scared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears are running down Sid's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, don't cry... not in front  of the instructors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack looks around at the faces, all staring back in judge not just the instructors. By now, the candidates know the symptoms of a DOR as well as anybody. The door to the chamber slams open and Foley is standing  there, grim-faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack is on morning "colors" duty. He and one of the lesse known candidates are raising the flag, a bugler standing  nearby, blowing "morning colors". Zack suddenly sees some that chills him. Sid and Foley stand in front of the Admin. Building, Fole saluting the flag, Sid just standing there arms at his si shoulders slumped. As the bugler finishes, Zack turns to his classmate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks into a run.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK WITH ZACK
dialogues.text: as he runs toward Foley and Sid and walks with them towar the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Foley) You didn't kick him out...? Wait,  didn't he tell you what he's been  going through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter what he's going  through. That's the whole purpose of  this zoo. What matters is he freaked  out for some reason at twenty-five  thousand feet and that can't ever  happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't understand. There's  this girl he's gotten pregnant and  she's putting him through hell, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, Zack. It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that it's all over? With  less than two weeks to go, you're  out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can still happen to you, too,  Mayo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley marches off like a windup toy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) Come back here, motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley spins around, his eyes sparkling wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you call me, Mayo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the D.I.'s were supposed  to help you in this place! What kind  of human being are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop eyeballing me, Mayo, or you're  out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Zack -- go back to the  barracks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it! He's the best  candidate in our class! Ask anyone!  The best student! The best leader!  The best friend to everybody! Couldn't  you bend your goddamn standards just  a little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, it wasn't him! He didn't ask  me to D.O.R. I came to him on my  own. (beat) I'm glad it's over, Zack. I really  mean that. He was right. I wasn't  doing this for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels his tears coming up so he runs off suddenly acro the parade ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid, wait! Where're you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid keeps running. Zack turns back to Foley and they star at each other a long moment before Zack bitterly salutes  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your permission, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley returns the salute and watches Zack walk off toward the barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack drives up on his motorcycle. Esther is in the yard,  gardening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Paula here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula suddenly appears on the porch, dressed in a simple  cotton dress, her hair un-coiffed, none of her Deb makeup

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula, he DORed and nobody's seen  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd he do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You know goddamn well what  happened so let's not play any games,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not playing any games! Go look  at Lynette's!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula slowly moves to him and gets on the motorcycle behi him. They speed off, Esther watching them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the porch of the old home she was born in, he hair up in curlers, doing her nails. The National Paper m sends up pillars of smoke on the horizon. A taxi drives u and Sid steps out, in a sport coat and tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, babe. Come on. I've got a couple  of things I want to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing out of uniform,  Sid? You don't want to get in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget that. Come on. Got a little  surprise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go like this. Can't you wait  a few minutes 'til I'm ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. I'm so happy I'm about to  bust. Here, honey. This is for you.  It cost me my whole savings, but I  said what the fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a little box. She opens it and finds an  engagement ring. She looks up at him, happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid! Oh, it's beautiful! You mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Let's get married,  Lynette. Let's find a justice of the  peace and just do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette tries the ring on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (euphoric) Let's go tell Paula! God, I wonder  where we'll be stationed first. I  hope it'll be Hawaii. I've always  wanted to go to Hawaii.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not gonna be stationed anywhere,  baby. I DORed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken) You what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to, baby... I'm no aviator. I  was faking it, like I was with  everything else in my life... up  'til right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... but what would we do? Where  would we go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oklahoma. I can get my old job back  at JC Penney's. In a couple of years,  I'll be floor manager. Oh, you're  gonna love Oklahoma, Lynette. You  and mama'll get along just great. Of  course, money will be a little tight  for a while, but we'll make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Sid, there's no baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not pregnant. I got my period  this morning. There's no baby, Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll be goddamned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid stares at her disbelievingly, but she's telling the t at least partly. There is no baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a big smile) What do you say we get married anyway?  I love you, Lynette. I'm in love  with you... and I didn't realize it  until right this second... but I've  never been happier in my life than I  have been the last seven weekends,  never more relaxed... more loved for  just who I am... (beat) Marry me, Lynette. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette looks off at the factory, then back at Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Sid, but I don't want to  marry you. I like you a lot and we  had ourselves some real nice times,  that's for sure... but I thought you  understood. I want to marry a pilot,  Sid. I want to live part of my life  overseas... the wife of an aviator,  Sid. (bitterly) Damn you! Goddamn you! Nobody DORs  after eleven weeks! Nobody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws the engagement ring at him and runs toward the house. Numb to his core, Sid slowly retrieves the ring an gets into her car. He starts it and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Come back with my car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette's Falcon takes a sudden turn. A split-second late Zack and Paula speed past in the opposite direction, miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack and Paula drive up and move toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They find her in the kitchen, sitting at the table, smoki a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette, where's Sid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already come and gone. Can you believe  it? He DORed in the twelfth week.  How can you win?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack grabs her by the shoulders and forces her to meet hi eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you tell him about the baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That there isn't one, as of today. I  had my period. (beat) I couldn't believe it. He still wanted  to marry me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you turned him down??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I don't want no Okie from  Muscogee. I can get that right here  in Port Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack starts shaking her angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little bitch! How could you? Was  there ever a baby, Lynette? That's  all I want to know! Did you make up  that baby, Lynette? Did you??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (caught) Of course there was a baby. I'd never  lie about something like that. Would  I, Paula?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Paula for support but she seems to be wonder the same things herself, and offers none. Zack abruptly p out of the room, leaving the two girls alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette, did you make up that baby  or didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynette's silence is answer enough. Paula suddenly slaps across the face with all her might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God help you, Lynette!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're no better than me, Paula!  You're just the same!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! That's not true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack is getting on his motorcycle as she emerges from the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to come with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he's my friend, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets on and he doesn't try to stop her. PAN as they d off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a pint bottle of bourbon, Sid weaves his way int the office. He smiles a quirky smile for the WOMAN behind the counter as he hands her some money and she gives him key. As he turns away from the counter, the woman calls after  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, is this yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up the engagement ring he bought for Lynette. S smiles, takes it from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever seen this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops the ring in his mouth and swallows it as the woma looks on, speechless. Sid weaves out.

dialogues.speaker: WE'RE TIGHT ON SID'S FACE
dialogues.text: as he trudges up the steps to the second floor of units. stay with him until he reaches his room and walks in, sla the door behind him to close the world out.

dialogues.speaker: WE STAY LIKE THAT, OUTSIDE HIS DOOR
dialogues.text: The SOUND of the TV going on, loud. Some game show. The  passage of about twenty seconds. Then the SOUND of Zack's MOTORCYCLE approaching, stopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here. She said he just came in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of FOOTSTEPS ascending to the second floor, run toward us. Zack PUSHES INTO SHOT and knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid, it's Zack. Open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply, then from inside some SOUNDS are heard, a CHAIR FALLING, a sudden, dull SNAPPING NOISE, abrupt and final. Zack throw his weight against the door and it splinters o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he looks up and pales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula steps into the doorway and utters a little gasp as sees what poor Sid had done to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big Okie hangs by his necktie from a cluster of expos drainage pipes in a corner of the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK'S FACE IS STRETCHED WITH PAIN
dialogues.text: Tears flood his eyes. He shakes his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God... why? Why, Sid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack cuts him down and cradles his friend's body in his a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid, fucking Okie! Why'd you  do it! Why didn't you talk to me  first? Why didn't you even try??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula watches from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the police cars and the one Shore Patrol seda from the base are pulling out of the Tides Inn lot, behin the ambulance that carries Sid's body. Paula stands on th upstairs landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop it. None of that's true.  Goddamnit, I love you. I loved you  ever since I met you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Paula! You were looking for  a ticket out of here and you didn't  care who it was, any more than you  cared with the last class of  candidates you and Lynette fucked  your way through, looking for a  husband! Or the class before that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You got the whole story just  right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beware of the Puget Debs -- and we  all laughed, especially him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a Puget Deb. I hate that  goddamn term!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However you got it figured, I didn't  kill Sid and Lynette didn't kill  him! He killed himself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not, but it is the truth. And  Zack, you didn't kill him either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes out the door. Paula can see him drive off on his  motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley calls muster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes notice of Zack's absence, unsurprised, before pu on the next name on the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack suddenly drives up on his motorcycle and walks towar the group, unshaven, tie askew, uniform totally wrinkled, eyes as red as sores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayo, the rest of your class knows  about candidate Worley, and we're  all sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, this officer candidate requests  permission to speak to you in private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm busy, Mayo. It'll have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayo, you didn't hear me -- I said I  I'm busy! And so are you! Go get  cleaned up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw screw it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to walk into the barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Martial arts demonstration in the  old blimp hangar in five minutes!  Mayo, you're my volunteer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack stops in his tracks and turns to face his antagonist He'll wait around for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley is up in the ring in his VC pajamas, watching them  take do their seats. Zack is the last to walk in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you waiting for, Mayo? Get  your scuzzy ass up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs up into the ring with Foley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put these on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Zack a set of safety-punch gloves and safety-kic foot pads. Zack sits on the canvas and puts them on. Fole already wears his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll start with some basic kicks.  You try to copy me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack gets to his feet and squares off opposite Foley.

dialogues.speaker: MOST OF ZACK'S CLASSMATES
dialogues.text: know about the incident in town with the locals, and the  word spreads quickly to the others in excited whispers. T share a common dream, these twenty-one survivors, to see  Foley broken and humbled.

dialogues.speaker: THE MARTIAL ARTS DEMONSTRATION
dialogues.text: Foley demonstrates a simple side kick, the heel of his fo slamming hard against Zack's jaw. As in the previous  demonstration, Foley isn't afraid of inflecting a little  punishment along with his instruction. He's unprepared,  however, for the skill and and speed with which Zack retu a version of that kick, the heel of his foot hitting Fole so solidly it rocks him back a couple of steps before he catch his balance. Foley grins, a rivulet of blood running down his chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looky-looky what we got. That's pretty  cute, Mayo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley executes a crescent kick, his specialty, and bloodi Zack's mouth. Zack returns a crescent kick that knocks th Marine right on his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on your feet and find out how  good, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Zack can get set, Foley seizes the offensive and s backing him across the ring with a series of fast kicks. Momentarily trapped in the corner, Zack ducks a punch, sl under a crescent kick, and hits his man three times in th face with his foam-padded knuckles, then follows with a k to the mid-section that makes the Marine sink to his knee with a silly expression on his face. Suddenly unafraid of Foley, the class rises to its feet a cheers Zack on. Ad-LIBS of "Get him, Zack!" "No mercy!" "Remember what he did to us!" Quieter mumblings of "Kill the motherfucker." Foley gets to his feet. Zack drops him instantly with a  jumpspinning back kick. Foley gets up again and manages to stay up for a short ti but it's a pathetic mismatch and Zack can land solidly at will with hands and feet. Finally, with a spinning outsid crescent kick that awes his classmates, Zack flattens him again. Foley just lies there, obviously spent. Zack offers him a hand. Foley looks up at him helplessly, shakes his head in defeat, and reaches out to accept his  help. Then, with shocking suddenness, Foley coils his knees to chest, yanks Zack toward him, and -- at the same time --  unleashes a kick straight to Zack's chin. Zack crumples t the canvas and lies there, barely conscious. Foley rises his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oldest trick in the book. Now, is  there anything you want to tell me,  Mayo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack shakes his head, no. Foley bows to him formally, the to the rest of the class, and marches like God's Warrior from the old hangar. Zack watches his classmates file out, leaving him alone i the cavernous hanger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack comes in by himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perryman looks up from his Navigation book as his only  surviving roommate enters. Zack looks at the two stripped bunks, the empty lockers... then he stares at his own loc for a long time, trying to make up his mind. Then Perryman gets up, puts a reassuring hand on his shou just for an instant, and goes back to his studies. Findin some coins in his locker, Zack leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack throws some money in to satisfy the operator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Byron, it's me. You doing anything  weekend after next? (beat) Yeah... it's graduation.

dialogues.speaker: GRADUATION MORNING ON THE BASE
dialogues.text: The sun is just rising and sending its colors across the  big, wide lawn where the graduation ceremony will soon ta place. Four enlisted men are positioning risers and folding chai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula gets up to the SOUND of her alarm. She hurries to t it off so as not to awaken her sisters. The time is 6:30 the morning. Time to go to work. Grudgingly, she relinqui the warmth of the bed, and trudges toward the bathroom in her pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula gets into Bunny's Toyota and the carpool drives on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Paula is punching in, Lynette, waiting in line behind  her, whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think of the new  mechanics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula glances off at the two boys Lynette is flirting wit father back in the line. Both could be her father's sons. Candidates for apehood. Paula has a faraway look on her face as she pulls her car from the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today's graduation. I hope he made  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack and his classmates are passing in review before the  Commanding Officer and his staff (including Foley), seate on the risers, and the large gathering of family and frie seated on the folding chairs. The base marching band, a  phalanx to the left of the rises, is in fine and rousing  form. As Zack and Casey and Perryman and the others pass CAMERA they do a precise EYES-RIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: BYRON IS APPLAUDING LOUDER THAN ANYBODY
dialogues.text: It's a proud moment for the reluctant father and he's not above letting the stiffer-looking parents around him know how he feels about having a son made it into the officer  ranks.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK SEE HIS FATHER
dialogues.text: and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GRADUATES.
dialogues.text: standing at attention on their risers, reciting their  commissioning oath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do solemnly swear that I will  support and defend the Constitution  of the United States of America  against all enemies foreign and  domestic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Casey's proud face, Perryman's, Della-Serra's, Marcu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that I will bear true faith and  allegiance to the same, that I take  this obligation freely without any  mental reservation or purpose of  evasion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA HOLDS ON Zack's face, his eyes moist, his voice ri with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with his classmates) ...that I will well and faithfully  discharge the duties of the office  on which I am about to enter. So  help me God.

dialogues.speaker: RANKS
dialogues.text: and are embracing their families and friends on the lawn. Byron finds Zack and the two men stare at one another war before warmth floods their faces and they come together i an embrace. Zack pulls a folded document from his breast  pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- my orders to Pensacola for  basic flight training... then it's  on to jets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Byron quickly glances at the orders and pounds Zack on th back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd make it! (beat) Where's your girl? Didn't she come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. That's over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Byron almost looks sad to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zackie, I'm so proud of you. Get  ready, 'cause I'm gonna give you  your first salute and you'll owe me  a silver dollar. That's the tradition,  you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to bring his hand up to salute his son but Zack grabs his wrist to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) No offense, Byron, but my first one's  gonna come from... him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over at:

dialogues.speaker: FOLEY, IN DRESS BLUES
dialogues.text: He cane propped characteristically behind him, the newer  notches clearly recognizable from the ones that predate t class, he watches them approach... one after the other, e of his worms, his scuzzes, his college pukes... and he re to them, as is the tradition, their first salute. In retu they hand him a silver dollar. Perryman pays up, then Casey approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (saluting) Congratulations Ensign Seeger, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. I mean, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a silver dollar and hurries off to rejoin h family.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK APPROACHES FOLEY
dialogues.text: and the Marine salutes him briskly, his heels clapping  together like a flamenco dancer's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Ensign Mayo, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never forget you as long as I  live, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack gives him a silver dollar and Foley pockets it and s off another brisk salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you in the fleet, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. See you in the fleet, Sarge.  And thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley just grins as Zack answers his salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING WITH ZACK ON HIS MOTORCYCLE. He still wears his dr whites and his gear is packed in a Navy seabag strapped t the back, as he drives away from the barracks, waving far to some of his classmates. As he rumbles past the parade  ground, he sees Foley addressing a spanking new class of  candidates, still in civvies, still sporting hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe what I'm seeing!  Look at all that hair! All those  lard bellies from junk food and pot!  Where you been all your lives, at an  orgy? Listening to Mick Jagger and  bad mouthing your country, I bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new class cracks up, laughing, as Zack motors past, h for the gates. It's hard to believe only thirteen weeks h elapsed since he heard those words for the first time. Se more like a lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack drives out and disappears down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula is at work on the line. The sweat of a long day sti her eyes as it stings the eyes of her fellow workers. Poo Paula. It's not hard to imagine her in a few years as Bun Hell, Lynette's already there. Old debs never die...

dialogues.speaker: THE WOMEN ON THE PAPER TOWEL LINE NEAR THE DOOR
dialogues.text: are the first to see him enter.

dialogues.speaker: ESTHER POKRIFKI
dialogues.text: stops her work as she sees the flash of gold on a Naval  shoulder board.

dialogues.speaker: THE WOMEN ON THE NAPKIN LINE
dialogues.text: send up a buzz of gossipy excitement as he strides past t So clean. So handsome. So perfect. Every deb's fantasy.

dialogues.speaker: HE WEARS THE DRESS WHITE UNIFORM WITH ENSIGN GOLD
dialogues.text: and he wears it proudly as he strides through their ranks toward the girl who is only now stopping to watch him  approach.

dialogues.speaker: PAULA CAN'T BELIEVE IT
dialogues.text: Almost as she might have dreamed it long ago as a little  girl, she watches him take her face in his hands and kiss her in such a romantic way that it's unlikely the women a National Paper, or any of us, will ever forget that kiss.

dialogues.speaker: LYNETTE AND BUNNY WATCH THAT KISS
dialogues.text: with a mingling of happiness and painful, desperate longi on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: ESTHER POKRIFKI
dialogues.text: is the second happiest Deb in the room.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER AGING DEBS IN THE HUGE FACTORY
dialogues.text: stop their work to watch. A few even applaud.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK SUDDENLY LIFTS PAULA IN HIS ARMS
dialogues.text: and with their eyes still touching, he carries her toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: LYNETTE'S FACE
dialogues.text: reveals all the jealousy that accompanies the happiness s is feeling for her friend. She's never leaving this place and she knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Paula! Way to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She adds her applause and half the factory is clapping an cheering by the time the officer and his girl reach the  doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack carries Paula out into the sunshine and kisses her a She's like candy, all right, and he'll never get enough.  PULL BACK INTO HELICOPTER SHOT that dwarfs them far below us, and... FADE OUT.
